Title: PaymentSplitter Beneficiary Amounts to Release Are Not Retrievable
Content:
The [`PaymentSplitter` implementation](https://github.com/Brushfam/openbrush-contracts/blob/553347354de6d0ead6a335ba4c197bdd01fb2d12/contracts/src/finance/payment_splitter/mod.rs) lacks a public function for beneficiaries to perform a read-only query of the current amount of funds they can [release](https://github.com/Brushfam/openbrush-contracts/blob/553347354de6d0ead6a335ba4c197bdd01fb2d12/contracts/src/finance/payment_splitter/mod.rs#L75-L77). As a result, they may be uncertain about whether the transaction cost will exceed the amount to be released, particularly when the releasable amount is low. Additionally, if there are no funds available for release, [the transaction will revert](https://github.com/Brushfam/openbrush-contracts/blob/553347354de6d0ead6a335ba4c197bdd01fb2d12/contracts/src/finance/payment_splitter/mod.rs#L169), causing users to incur costs unnecessarily.


Consider adding a [`releasable` function](https://github.com/OpenZeppelin/openzeppelin-contracts/blob/17c1a3a4584e2cbbca4131f2f1d16168c92f2310/contracts/finance/PaymentSplitter.sol#L127), similar to the one implemented in older versions of the OpenZeppelin contracts library. This function would allow beneficiaries to check how much money they can release, even when they have no funds available for release.


***Update:** Resolved in [pull request #146](https://github.com/Brushfam/openbrush-contracts/pull/146) at commit [4e81921](https://github.com/Brushfam/openbrush-contracts/pull/146/commits/4e819215639880059f1764a1a6a9f549e0733b4f).*
